ul.li: Služba realizuje účinek, který má hodnotu pro jejího uživatele
Charakteristiky: encapsulation, reusability, loose coupling, contracting, abstraction, discoverability, composability
Obecně se jedná o nějaké rozhraní (a jeho dokumentaci), které je realizováno nějakým počtem implementací
Zdroj (resource) je univerzálně identifikovaný pomocí URI
A resource in REST corresponds to one or more entities of a data model, its identifier (URI) serves as a way to access it

A data model entity may be accessible through multiple identifiers, such as \(/orders/\{customer\_id\}/\{order\_id\}\) and \(/customers/\{customer\_id\}/orders/\{order\_id\}\). This is called URI aliasing and it's a good practice to limit it.
A Query serves to opt into selection, projection, or other processing instructions (e.g. \(/customers/?status=valid\))
Capability URL is a short-term URL, e.g. for verification
REST používá HTTP/S, SOAP podporuje jiné způsoby přenosu, např. SMTP
REST většinou pro data používá JSON, SOAP vždy XML
REST používá HTTP metody podle jejich sémantiky, SOAP (v případě HTTP) vše tahá přes POST

note.div: Creating new TCP connections is expensive (requires a full round trip)
HTTP keepalive = TCP connection is reused for multiple requests/responses, this reduces latency (three-way handshake is expensive)

ul.li: Requests are pipelined one after another, this saves one request and response propagation latency
Issues: a single slow response blocks all requests behind it, this may be resolved by using multiple TCP connections
